subject: Leadership
title: Transparent Communication
description: A fast breakdown of Transparent Communication for builders.

hook.text: A startup shares financials with every employee. Morale and ownership soar. Competitors guard the same data.

buildup.text: Transparency means sharing relevant information openly rather than hoarding it as a source of power or control.

discovery.text: Buffer publishes all salaries publicly. Result: higher trust, lower turnover, and easier recruiting.

twist.text: Full transparency isn't always wise. Leaders must balance openness with discretionâ€”some info needs context first.

climax.text: The rule: default to open. Only withhold when sharing would cause harm, and explain why info is limited.

punchline.text: Secrets breed suspicion. Sharing breeds trust.

quiz.question: What is the recommended default for team communication?
options: Default to open, withhold only when necessary
Share only on a need-to-know basis
